result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BOND REINSTATED ON 3/18/22 WITH PREVIOUS CONDITIONS AS ORDERED:

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Anna Ramasa appeared by video, in custody from the Brown County jail, 

Atty Bergner states he was not aware of this case as well. 
Court reviews the case.  Initial appearance was set in January and a public defender had been appointed. 
Defendant makes statements to the court.  She did contact her attorney after she missed the appearance.  She's been in custody for a month now and not able to get ahold of her attorney, Jessica Phelps. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant provides a current address.   She has been held on this warrant for a month now.  She is being held on Brown County cases.  
Court reviews the minutes from January 18th.  

BY THE COURT:  Court quashes the warrant. 

Atty Dodge requests the bond be reinstated.  Asks the matter to be set for 4/18 to track with other matters

BY THE COURT:  Signature bond is reinstated with conditions as previously ordered. 

Defendant questions the court.  Asks to have Atty Phelps information sent to her at the Brown County jail. 
Court asks the ADA Dodge to contact Atty Phelps to let her know she is in the Brown County jail.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:42 PM Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps appeared by video.   Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
